handDesc.p:
This inscription uses an unusual shape of basic punctuation, which does not look like a comma but rather like a simple vertical bar or daṇḍa. The pasangan , <ṣ> and

are written in the modern fashion (?) on the same line, and not below the line as it is still usually the case in the Majapahit period. We observe two shapes of anusvāra in this inscription, with the alternative round shape appearing for instance l. 2v5. The scribe uses two ways of forming akṣara lā: with tarung placed to the right of the akṣara, most frequent with tarung written in “superscript” form: 3r1 prajālāṅkarā

projectDesc.p: This project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_IdListMembers_V01.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: updates following comments by argr in google doc

div.p:
śeka, dyaḥ hayām· vuruk·, Iniriṁ denyājñā pāduka śrī tribhuvanottuṅgarājadevī jayaviṣṇuva
rddhani, sakala-rāja-maṅgala-bhavatī-pratimaā, lalita-manohara-jñāna-pratāpa-śobhita, sārddhanāriī§
śvara muAṁ pāduka bhaṭāra śrī kr̥tavarddhana, Aśeṣa-rāja-praṇipata-māṇḍitā, sacchaya muAṁ Ājñaā pā
duka śrī vijayadevī, mahārāja-rāja-śekkharādhiṣṭitānindita-vīryyalaṅkarā, sakala-guṇa-pra
vāla-buddhi-sahitā, sārddhanārīśvara muAṁ pāduka bhaṭāra śrī vijayarājasā, saṅgrama-vīryyalaṅkr̥ta,

tinaḍaḥ de rakryan mahāmantrī katrīṇi, rakryan mahāmantrī I hino, dyaḥ IĪśvara, rakryan mahāmantrī §
sirikan·, dyaḥ Ipo, rakryan mahāmantrī I halu, dyaḥ kañciṁ,

Umiṁsor i taṇḍa rakryan riṁ pakira-kiran ma
kabehan·, saṅ āryya senaāpati pu tanu, saṅ āryyātmarāja pu taṇḍiṁ, rakryan· dmuṁ pu gaṣṭi, rakryan ka
nuruhan· pu turut·, rakryan· raṅga pu lurukan·, rakryan tumǝṅguṁ pu nāla, sāddhu-gopika-durjjana-vi§
nigraha-tatpara, mavastha patiḥ ri pajaṁ, samahiriṁ muAṁ rake juru paṅalasan· pu pṭul·, naya-vi
3
naya-dhara, makapramukkha saṁ mantrīṅgitājñā prajālaṅkarākāra, rake mapatiḥ pu mada, sakala-nīti-vr̥ha§
spati-saṅgrāmikā, prāṇarakṣaka śrī mahārāja pranaṇālāmratisubaddhakǝn· paṅḍiri śrī mahārājā
ṅkǝn· IĪśvaraprativimba, gumavayakǝn· hitakarmmaniṁ yavadvīpamāaṇḍala, muAṁ viśīrṇnaniṁ praāṁmu
khe pāduka śrī mahārāja, dharmmaādhyakṣa riṁ kasevan·, saṅ āryya rājaparākrama, ḍaṅ ācā§
ryya darmmarāja, dharmmaādhyakṣa riṁ kasogatan·, saṅ āryyadhirāja, ḍaṅ ācāryya kanakamuni,
boddha-śāstra-vyākaraṇa-parisamāpta,

tlas karuhun saṁ dharmmapravakta vyavahāra-vicchedaka, saṁ pamgǝ§
t i tiruAn·, saṅ āryya vaṅśādhirāja, ḍaṅ ācāryya śivanātha, bhairavapakṣa nyaāya-vyaākaraṇa-śā
stra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i kaṇḍamuhi, ḍaṅ ācāryya marmmanātha, mapañjy āṁśuman·, sorapakṣa nyāya-vyaā
karaṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i maṅhuri, ḍaṅ ācāryya smaranātha, bhairavapakṣa nyāya-vyaāka
raṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta, samgǝt i jāmba, ḍaṅ ācāryya jayasmara, sorapakṣa śaṅkyasāṁkhya-śāstra-parisamā
4
pta, samgǝt i pamuAtan· ḍaṅ ācāryyāgreśvara bhairavapakṣa nyāya-vyaākaraṇa-śāstra-parisamāpta,
samgǝt i kaṇḍaṅan rarai, ḍaṅ ācāryya munīndra, boddha-śāstra-parisamāpta,

maṁrasa-rasani saṅka ri gə:ṁniy a
ddhimuktinikaṁ vyavahāri kāliḥ, kuapva pgat kavivakṣanya de saṁ pragvivāka matguḥ ri kapakṣaddharmman·
ri daL̥m nāgara, marmmanikaṁ vyāvaharivyavahāri kāliḥ sacchaya mampak-āmpak· humatur i taṇḍa rakryan· riṁ
pakira-kiran makabehan·, mintonakǝn· pakṣanya sovaṁ-sovaṁ, kunǝṁ suṅan· vara-varaḥ Aki
santaāna, mapañji śaraṇa, muAṁ sarovaṁnya, ki karṇna, mapañji manākara, Ajaran· reka, ki siran·, ki jumput·§
Uṅsun madr̥vya lmaḥ punaṁ manah i manuk·, kayoniṁ savaḥ, Aḍavuṁ, liriḥ, 1, I beR̥m·, liriḥ, 1, I pa⌈
jnon· kidul iṅ umaḥ, liriḥ, 2, pajnon· kubvan·, kuñci, 1, paṅeran·, kubvan·, kuñci 1 tiga thaāni, ka
yoniṁ savaḥ vareṁ, liriḥ, 1, kayon·, valuntas·, liriḥ, 10, tiga thāni kubvan·, kuñci, 1, dinanā
kǝn iṁ tuha-tuha mariṁ katyaāgan· pakaṇḍaṅan·, liriḥ, 16, mariṁ maṇḍala riṁ kukub·, liriḥ, 2, mariṁ jaṅgan iṁ pa
5
ṅle, liriḥ 1, kabhukti deniṅ amadr̥vyakǝn·, liriḥ 33, piṇḍa liriḥ 67, punika ta sthiti bhukti saṅkeṁ tu
ha-tuha, bapa, kaki buyut·, pituṁ, Aṅgas·, muniṁ, kr̥pǝk·, tan hanaṁ suvanda, Apan anaādi kabhuktyanipun·, maka
vyakti kīrttini tuha-tuhaniṁ Uṅsun· bale I maṇḍala I kasḍahan·, sśakakaāla, 919, vayuhanǝṅaḥ ra
kva Aranipun·, punika ta samaānakāla lāvan· savaḥ, Apituvin tan hana savahipun samasānak i punaṁ sī
ma tiga, livat iṁ vatǝs· pakaṇḍaṅan·, tan punika davakta lmah i Uṁsun· tanpa tahil· tan kajnǝṅan· ta
n pinakaparanati deniṁ deśa, makahetu Anaādi kābhuktyanipun·, tan· vruḥ ta Uṅsun panaṅkanipun· A
pan anaādi, maṅke ta Inakunipun pasaṇḍan pun samasānak i sīma tiga, makādipun apañji Anavuṁ harṣa, kunǝṁ
suṅan· vara-varaḥ samasānak i sīma tiga, makādi saṅ apañjy anavuṁ harṣa, Uṅsun madr̥vya punaṁ lmaḥ savidak·
pituṁ liriḥ vicaāravisṣaya, sinaṇḍakǝn i pituṅ i Uṅsun iṁ pirak kali tṅaḥ takǝr·, duk punaṁ bhuūmi java tan paga
gaman pisis· Ika taṁ pakṣa kāliḥ, pinametakǝn· śaāstradr̥ṣṭa, deśadr̥ṣṭa, Udāharaṇa, guru kaka,
makataṅgvan· rasāgama ri saṁ hyaṁ kuṭāramānavādi, maṅanukāra pravr̥ttyacāra saṁ pāṇḍita vyavahāraviccheda
ka riṁ puhun malama,

At=hǝr taṇḍa rakryan· motus ataña-taña Irikaṁ piṅgir siriṅ udāsĭna, polihana nyaāyā
nyaāyanikaṁ pakṣa kāliḥ kunaṁ pājarnikaṁ piṅgir siriṁ, Aṅruṅu yan sīma sasaṇḍan· ndan avidhdita ta saṁkaniṅ u§
jar·, Irika ta yan katmu sor i pakṣa samasānak i sīma tiga, makādi mapañjy anavuṁ harṣa, makahetu
tan hananiṁ pramāṇa, yan pituṁ saṅ apañjy anavuṁ harṣa Anaṇḍakǝn·, muAṁ AsāmbavaAsambhavaniṁ vruha, makādi
ṅ anaādi kabhuktyanipun·,

mataṁnyan balavaān pakṣāki santaāna mapañji sśaraṇa, muAṁ sarovaṁnya, hetunya
n sinuṅa kmitana saṁ hyaṅ ājñā haji jaya soṁ, mratisubaddhakǝn· pagǝh i paṅrakṣa taṇḍa rakryan· ri pa
kṣa saṅ apañji sśaraṇa, ri vruha saṅ apañji sśaraṇa prayatna // O // §

app.note: Boechari also omits the preceding comma.

See parallel segment l. 6r3. It is however possible that the scribe did intervene to correct this omission by means of a kakāpada placed above the line, and a very small akṣara ra below the line. These annotations are however very small and could simply be considered as scratches.

div.p: First edited by Brandes, republished by Pigeaud and edited again by Boechari (97-100 E.35); re-edited here by Marine Schoettel from the estampage of the plate made available by the Museum Nasional Indonesia.
